author: Nicholas Bariyo
title: Sierra Leone Inaugurates Former Junta Head as President
text:
A former military junta leader educated in the U.S. was sworn in as Sierra Leone’s new president after a narrow election victory, and now faces the task of rebuilding a resource-rich economy racked by a global slump in commodity prices and the Ebola epidemic.
Opposition leader Julius Maada Bio, who briefly ruled Sierra Leone in 1996, won 52% of ballots in a hotly contested runoff against the ruling party candidate, the country’s electoral commission said late Wednesday. The 53-year-old was immediately sworn in as head of state...
